availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Hardwick (Hartford, Ohio County, Kentucky, merchant and soldier)

body.p: Hartford, Ohio County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah F. Hardwick. Father of Clarence Hardwick, Elizabeth Hardwick, Juliett Hardwick, Robert Hardwick, Catharine Hardwick, Annie Hardwick, Charles Hardwick. Merchant in Ohio County in 1850. Merchant in Ohio County in 1860. Mustered in as a private in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) on November 24, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, District 1, p. 49A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio, Hartford, p. 786.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio, Hartford, p. 500B
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 847.
Find A Grave, "William Hardwick (October 9, 1819-February 25, 1883)," Memorial #32174872, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/32174872 (accessed January 14, 2019).
